section_1_text.eng:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.

rows.section_1_text:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the “Support Contacts” section in your Library for help.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about coping with grief.

Grief affects us all in different ways.

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about coping with grief.

Grief affects us all in different ways.

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.

media_title.eng: What techniques can you use to cope with grief? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief.

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.

rows.media_title: What techniques can you use to cope with grief? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief.

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Taking care of ourselves during grief helps us stay calm and present for our children. 
When we share and name our feelings openly, it can help the whole family feel less alone and more supported.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Taking care of ourselves during grief helps us stay calm and present for our children. 
When we share and name our feelings openly, it can help the whole family feel less alone and more supported.

media_title.eng: Hear how naming feelings helped @data.characters.media_female_12.name feel closer to family while grieving

media_transcript.eng:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We don’t feel alone anymore.

rows.media_title: Hear how naming feelings helped @data.characters.media_female_12.name feel closer to family while grieving
rows.media_transcript:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We don’t feel alone anymore.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour – especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

Let’s see what happened with @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name who lost her mother 6 months ago:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour – especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

Let’s see what happened with @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name who lost her mother 6 months ago:

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, you need to stop crying. It has been months already! This crying will not bring your @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name back and you are doing worse and worse in school!

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, you need to stop crying. It has been months already! This crying will not bring your @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name back and you are doing worse and worse in school!

character_2_text.eng: You just don't understand how I feel! You never listen!

rows.character_2_text: You just don't understand how I feel! You never listen!

rows.character_1_text: Stop being so dramatic! Your behaviour is unacceptable!

character_1_text.eng: Stop being so dramatic! Your behaviour is unacceptable!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f4_father.name’s response make his daughter, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, telling someone to stop crying can make them feel even more sad, angry or confused.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, telling someone to stop crying can make them feel even more sad, angry or confused.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, telling someone to stop crying can make them feel even more sad, angry or confused.

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: Take a pause before responding and notice his own emotions

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, all these options are correct.

When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: Ask @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name to share more about how she feels

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng:
Yes, all these options are correct.

When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: Give @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name a hug and tell her she can talk to him

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng:
Yes, all these options are correct.

When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: Ask @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name what would help her feel better

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng:
Yes, all these options are correct.

When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Thank you for thinking along!

Let’s see what happens if @data.characters.f4_father.name tries to support @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Thank you for thinking along!

Let’s see what happens if @data.characters.f4_father.name tries to support @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name:

character_1_text.eng: I know you are sad, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name. I also miss @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name. What do you think we can do to help you feel better?

character_2_text.eng: Maybe we can visit @data.characters.f4_aunt.role_name, so we can share stories about @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name?

rows.character_1_text: I know you are sad, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name. I also miss @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name. What do you think we can do to help you feel better?
rows.character_2_text: Maybe we can visit @data.characters.f4_aunt.role_name, so we can share stories about @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name?

rows.character_1_text: I like that idea, let’s go see her on Saturday. Do you already want to tell me more about how you feel now?

character_1_text.eng: I like that idea, let’s go see her on Saturday. Do you already want to tell me more about how you feel now?

rows.character_1_text: I honestly feel angry that she left. Is it okay to say that?

character_1_text.eng: I honestly feel angry that she left. Is it okay to say that?

rows.character_1_text: Yes, it is normal to feel angry. We all have different feelings at different times, and that is okay. It is good to talk about this together, thank you for sharing with me.

character_1_text.eng: Yes, it is normal to feel angry. We all have different feelings at different times, and that is okay. It is good to talk about this together, thank you for sharing with me.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel after talking to her father, @data.characters.f4_father.name?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s right. Talking about her feelings helped @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel lighter and less alone inside.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, knowing that her @data.characters.f4_father.role_name understood and accepted her feelings made @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel cared for and supported.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Exactly. Sharing her sadness and anger openly made @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel comforted and closer to her father.

quiz_2_question.eng: What could have happened if @data.characters.f4_father.name got angry at his daughter, @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name, when she shared that she was feeling angry?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name and her @data.characters.f4_father.role_name might talk less and feel more alone

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That’s right. Talking about her feelings helped @data.characters.f4_daughter_13.name feel lighter and less alone inside.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some tips to help you and your family through times of grief:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some tips to help you and your family through times of grief:

section_1_text.eng:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. There’s no right way to feel, and no need to feel better quickly.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, confused, or unwell. They may have nightmares, pain, or school problems. Even if they seem happy, they might still feel sad. This is all normal.

section_2_text.eng:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.

section_3_text.eng:
Talking or writing about the person can help bring comfort. Gently share your memories—both the happy ones and the hard ones.

Teens may sometimes feel the death was their fault. Kindly remind them it was not. Let them know they can always talk to you about their feelings, and show them it’s okay by sharing yours too.

rows.section_1_text:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. There’s no right way to feel, and no need to feel better quickly.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, confused, or unwell. They may have nightmares, pain, or school problems. Even if they seem happy, they might still feel sad. This is all normal.
rows.section_2_text:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.
rows.section_3_text:
Talking or writing about the person can help bring comfort. Gently share your memories—both the happy ones and the hard ones.

Teens may sometimes feel the death was their fault. Kindly remind them it was not. Let them know they can always talk to you about their feelings, and show them it’s okay by sharing yours too.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel.

Let’s practise naming feelings. How do you feel now?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel.

Let’s practise naming feelings. How do you feel now?

quiz_1_question.eng: How could a person feel when someone they love passes away?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful — all of these are normal.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful — all of these are normal.

quiz_1_feedback_6.eng: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful — all of these are normal.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This week's home activity is to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.

You can remind your teen of some emotions they might feel - like happy, sad, scared, hopeful, angry, or lonely. There is no right or wrong feeling. Sharing emotions helps you both feel less alone.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week's home activity is to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.

You can remind your teen of some emotions they might feel - like happy, sad, scared, hopeful, angry, or lonely. There is no right or wrong feeling. Sharing emotions helps you both feel less alone.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you share how you are feeling with your teen this week and invite them to name their feelings too?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s wonderful. Talking about emotions helps you and your teen cope and connect during difficult times.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That’s a good start. Even trying to open a conversation about feelings can help your teen feel supported. Keep going - you are doing something very important.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Talking about feelings can be hard, especially during grief. Try again when the time feels right - every small step towards openness helps.

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you share how you are feeling with your teen this week and invite them to name their feelings too?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That’s wonderful. Talking about emotions helps you and your teen cope and connect during difficult times.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That’s a good start. Even trying to open a conversation about feelings can help your teen feel supported. Keep going - you are doing something very important.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. Talking about feelings can be hard, especially during grief. Try again when the time feels right - every small step towards openness helps.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Grief can make both parents and teens feel alone - but talking about your feelings can help you cope together. Even small steps like checking in and sharing emotions can rebuild trust and connection.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Grief can make both parents and teens feel alone - but talking about your feelings can help you cope together. Even small steps like checking in and sharing emotions can rebuild trust and connection.

media_title.eng: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name and her father learned to support each other

media_transcript.eng:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.

rows.media_title: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name and her father learned to support each other
rows.media_transcript:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.
